conclusion: The process is cyclic: A → B → C → D → A.
State A has a temperature \( T_A = 27^\circ \text{C} = 300 \text{ K} \).
The pressure at state A is \( p_A = 1 \times 10^5 \text{ Pa} \).
The pressure at state B is \( p_B = 1 \times 10^5 \text{ Pa} \).
The volume at state A is \( V_A = 3 \text{ L} \).
The volume at state B is \( V_B = 4 \text{ L} \).
The ideal gas law is given by: \( pV = nRT \).

premise: Since the number of moles \( n \) and the gas constant \( R \) are constant.
Using the equation \( \frac{p_A V_A}{T_A} = \frac{p_B V_B}{T_B} \) and substituting known values.
conclusion: Substitute: \( \frac{(1 \times 10^5 \text{ Pa})(3 \text{ L})}{300 \text{ K}} = \frac{(1 \times 10^5 \text{ Pa})(4 \text{ L})}{T_B} \).
